newsitem.title: ESTONIA: TRADE SLOWS, BANKS GAIN FURTHER.
newsitem.headline: TRADE SLOWS, BANKS GAIN FURTHER.

text.p: kroons on the Tallinn bourse on Thursday but banking shares
Dealers said the market is expecting first half results and
1997 profit revisions and falls are not seen.
"First half audited results may give an important
impression to western investors...who take into account audited
results instead of monthly balance sheets," one dealer said.
Hoiupank rose five kroons to 151 kroons in trade of 10.3
million kroons as the market responded to news that Swedbank
was set to up its stake in the bank.
Swedbank said on Thursday that it had reached an agreement
with the Estonian central bank to acquire a 7.4 percent of the
bank's shares, which would raise its stake to 19.9 percent.
On the free market, privatisation vouchers were most traded
